Warn if palette specified with static aesthetic

Source: R/utils.R
warn_palette_ignored.Rd

Educates users when they specify a palette parameter but use a static color instead of a variable mapping. The palette parameter only applies to variable mappings (discrete or continuous scales), not static colors.

Usage

warn_palette_ignored(aesthetic_type, palette, param_name)

Arguments

aesthetic_type

List returned from detect_aesthetic_type()

palette

Character or NULL. The palette argument value

param_name

Character. Name of the aesthetic parameter ("color" or "fill")

Value

NULL (called for side effect of warning)

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# This will warn
warn_palette_ignored(
  list(type = "static_color", value = "blue"),
  palette = "bright",
  param_name = "fill"
)
# Warning: `palette` argument ignored when `fill` is a static color

# This will NOT warn (palette is used)
warn_palette_ignored(
  list(type = "variable_mapping"),
  palette = "bright",
  param_name = "fill"
)
} # }
